results.title: The NABC's of basketball: individual offense
results.brief_description: Gene Bartow, Coach of the Year in 1973, relates the drills that his players use to develop individual offensive skills. Shows drills for guards, forwards and centres, as well as exercises for two-man situations.
results.description: Gene Bartow, Coach of the Year in 1973, relates the drills that his players use to develop individual offensive skills. Shows drills for guards, forwards and centres, as well as exercises for two-man situations.

results.title: Shooting: Norm Stewart
results.brief_description: Coach Norm Stewart analyses the jump-shot and one-hand free throw. The jump-shot is viewed through its various phases while the one-hand free throw is broken into four main areas: body position, ball position, aiming, and the motion.
results.description: Coach Norm Stewart analyses the jump-shot and one-hand free throw. The jump-shot is viewed through its various phases while the one-hand free throw is broken into four main areas: body position, ball position, aiming, and the motion.

results.title: Killer track
results.brief_description: Deals with long distance runner Tony Rafferty and his attempt to run the Birdsville Track from Maree to Birdsville. Endeavours to explain Rafferty’s motivation and shows the stress involved and levels of endurance required for such a run.

results.title: Gold!
results.creator_credit: Irwin Rosten, National Geographic Society and WQED
results.brief_description: A journey to various parts of the world to discover how gold is mined, transported, and used, and how it affects our daily lives. Not central to any one subject area but useful as a resource for studies of monetary systems, prejudices, values, religious aspects, etc. Narrated by E.G. Marshall. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Defender: Colin Todd
results.creator_credit: Terry Ryan, Ray Marshall and I S L E
results.brief_description: Colin Todd, one of the British Football League’s most respected back-four players, shows that defenders need more than just brute force. He illustrates that positional play and marking are just as vital as tackling and clearing the ball.

results.title: Merrily we roll along
results.creator_credit: Robert L Bendick and Xerox Films
results.brief_description: Presents a rare combination of historical accuracy and humorous entertainment in an informal history of America’s love affair with automobiles. Narrated by Groucho Marx.

results.title: Understanding alcohol: use and abuse
results.creator_credit: Tad Stones and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Discusses the physical, mental and social effects of alcohol and describes the four stages of inebriation. Examines the various factors which may lead to the use and abuse of alcohol. Narrated by Ralph Story.

results.title: More than blood and bandages
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Nicholas Cockram, Slater Studios and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A documentary designed to make the public aware of the variety of activities in which the Red Cross is involved. Shows the Red Cross responding to the needs of the sick, the handicapped, the disabled and the distressed.
